intro: Thlaspi vulcanorum, commonly known as the Vulcan's cabbages, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit and features small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or volcanic soils, often in alpine or subalpine regions. It has hairy leaves and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Thlaspi vulcanorum is sometimes considered a rare or endemic species, depending on the region.
